text: hi everyone today I'm making Boombah
head guy or the Vietnamese vegetarian
spicy noodle soup Boombah is the second
most famous Vietnamese noodle soup after
fall and its originates from Pei the
imperial capital city of Vietnam today
let's meet the vegan version of it let's
begin recipe to make the vegetarian
broth for the noodle soup you're going
to need a variety of vegetables today I
use one shallow tea you can also use
kohlrabi instead 1 carrot 1 cup corn 1
jicama and an apple or you can also use
a pear you can also use daikon cabbage
or coral for the stop just peel all the
vegetables rinse well and cut into cubes
then place all the cut vegetables into a
large stock pot filled with about 4
liters of waters 1qr blood sugar about
the size of your thumb and a tablespoon
of salt bring it to a boil and lower the
heat to about medium to medium-low and
cook the vegetables for about 1 to 2
hours but the toppings you're going to
need 2 tofu + you can buy these pre
fried tofu blocks at the Asian market
cut into you about half a centimeter
thick slices I also buy a package of
mushrooms they're our King oyster
mushrooms shiitake and oaky etc you can
use any other kinds of mushrooms that
you like just soaking in salted water
and rinse well then cut into bite-size
pieces I also bought some kickball API
or mock with make from textured soy
beans you can probably get this at the
dry foot session or vegan fruit session
Adoration store you want to soak them in
water for about 15 minutes to soften and
then squeeze out the excess water
you can substitute this for wheat gluten
or Saipan also called me come in via me
I'll just simply skip it the tofu and
mushrooms are good enough
what maximum wahoo is so delicious is
the Satya comes with it to make Saturday
you will need the white part of a leek
just filing minx
you also need about three tablespoons of
minced lemongrass a tablespoons of
minced garlic and some mint Chile's to
give the broth an amazing fragrance you
also need about five to eight stop
chopped lemongrass you a pestle to
slightly bruise them now heat about four
to five tablespoons of vegetable oil in
a wolf
then add the wings lemongrass garlic
leeks and chillies and saute until the
amazing fragrance comes out also
throwing the Bruce lemongrass pot oh my
god is now so good
whoop ahoy has to be spicy so actually
flakes or chili powder as much as you
can take about two to three tablespoons
and then also add a tablespoon of sugar
and a tablespoon of mushroom seasonings
so take for about one to two minutes
then remove the lemongrass stops and
transfer to the vegetable stock pot also
take out half of the satay and put into
a small bowl this will be served as
actual continuing next to the noodle
bowls later now you want to add the mock
beef into the rest of the satay in the
wall and stir fry for about one to two
minutes so it can absorb the amazing
fragrance and flavor and also add in the
mushrooms the bigger ones going first
and then the rest stir until the
mushrooms cook and you can season more
to your taste with more vegetarian stock
powder or mushroom seasonings and then
finally you can add the tofu cubes so
gently now because you don't want to
prick the tofu then turn off the heat
and set aside if you would like you can
also ask some vegetarian ham or sausage
and actually the noodle bowl as extras
cook some thick brown rice vermicelli
noodles according to the package
instructions and transfer to a serving
bowl top with the stir fried mushrooms
the fools and mock beef and also some of
the satay adjust the seasonings of the
stockpot to your taste with massage or
mushroom seasonings and then later the
hot soup over the noodle bowl wow it
looks so good the broth is very clear
but it's very fragrant and delicious
then add more vegan ham and garnish with
some chopped cilantro you can serve one
more head Zhai with a high platter of
fresh vegetables like bok choy or banana
blossom sandra mu ka or split water
spinach some bean sprouts and Vietnamese
herbs like mint or perilla to serve
squeeze some lime juice add more satay
to your bowl
slapping out this flavorful and
fragrance noodle bowl you will realize
that vegetarian food don't have to be
bland at all it smells amazing and is
packed with flavors I hope you're going
